overview: The Symphonic Ensembles (including large instrumental bands and orchestras) play an important role in the educational and performance activities of the Melbourne Conservatorium of Music (MCM). Students participating in Symphonic Ensembles rehearse and perform a wide variety of works from the symphonic canon. Following an audition, students are placed in up to two of the following ensembles:
Auditions for all ensembles are usually held in February.
This subject is marked on a pass/fail basis and is not included in the weighted average mark (WAM) calculation.

This subject is co-delivered with MUSI10060 Symphonic Ensembles 1, MUSI20093 Symphonic Ensembles 1, MUSI20124 Symphonic Ensembles 1 (Breadth), MUSI30185 Symphonic Ensembles 1, MUSI30279 Symphonic Ensembles 1 (Breadth), MUSI90217 Orchestral Instrument Performance 1, and MUSI90224 Orchestral Instrument Performance 3. Students cannot simultaneously enrol in co-delivered subjects in the same study period.
100% punctual attendance is expected at all rehearsals and performance, as directed.

additional pre-requisite: AUDITION: Students are required to request an audition for this subject. Follow the link below to locate the relevant audition form.
This subject requires a successful audition outcome to enrol. A successful audition outcome may be used as proof of permission to enrol with the submission of an Enrolment Assistance form to Stop 1.

assessments.description: Preparation of parts, individual and/or sectional practice and active participation in all rehearsals, classes and performances as directed. 3000 words (equivalent)
3 web-based tasks, based on assigned reading, relevant to the experience of music performance, in week 4, 8 and 12. 1000 words (equivalent)
Hurdle requirement:. Students must attend a minimum of 80% of all scheduled classes, rehearsals and performances as directed.

Semester 1.Contact hours: Up to 72 hours over the course of the semester

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.

Symphonic Contacts: For symphonic-related enquiries, please contact your head of area:

Breadth options: This subject is available as breadth in the following courses:
Bachelor of Fine Arts (Film and Television)
Available to Study Abroad and/or Study E: This subject is available to students studying at the University from eligible overseas institutions on exchange and study abroad. Students are required to satisfy any listed requirements, such as pre- and co-requisites, for enrolment in the subject.
